definition: unhealthy or unwell; poor or bad; can be used as a modifier meaning "negatively" or "improperly",, presaging ill fortune, an often persistent bodily disorder or disease
details:
adverb
- unhealthy or unwell; poor or bad; can be used as a modifier meaning "negatively" or "improperly",
= example: unhealthy or unwell; poor or bad; can be used as a modifier meaning "negatively" or "improperly",
= synonyms: badly, poorly
- with difficulty or inconvenience
- unfavorably or with disapproval
= example: unfavorably or with disapproval
= synonyms: badly
adjective
- presaging ill fortune
= example: presaging ill fortune
= synonyms: ominous
- distressing
= example: distressing
- resulting in suffering or adversity
= example: resulting in suffering or adversity
- indicating hostility or enmity
= example: indicating hostility or enmity
- affected by an impairment of normal physical or mental function
= example: affected by an impairment of normal physical or mental function
= synonyms: sick
noun
- an often persistent bodily disorder or disease
= synonyms: complaint
